response:
MRI is critical to confirm lesions and dissemination in space/time. A CT Chest is necessary to investigate the CXR ground-glass changes (suspicion of sarcoidosis). Lumbar puncture and serology are required to differentiate between MS, Sarcoidosis, and antibody-mediated diseases (NMO/MOG).

investigations = ["MRI of brain and whole spine with contrast", "High-resolution CT Chest", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF analysis for OCBs, protein, glucose, cell count, ACE)", "Serum ACE", "Aquaporin-4 antibodies (NMO-IgG)", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-Reactive Protein", "Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate", "ANA and ENA panel", "Calcium profile", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology"]
